abstract.p: Eric Asimov Tastings column cites Santa Barbara County, Calif, wines worth seeking out; list; photo (M)

block.p: THE Santa Barbara County wines listed here are worth seeking out. Some, like the Longaria and the Whitcrafts, are made in small lots and may be found only in a few restaurants.
THE Santa Barbara County wines listed here are worth seeking out. Some, like the Longaria and the Whitcrafts, are made in small lots and may be found only in a few restaurants.

Most wines from the newer vineyards at the western end of the Santa Ynez Valley have not been released, but on the basis of a barrel tasting, I recommend the 1999 chardonnays and pinot noirs of Brewer-Clifton, the chardonnays of Melville Vineyards, the exceptional pinot noirs of Sanford Winery and the Crown Vineyard pinot noir of Foley Estate. Some of these wines can be ordered on the Internet at www .winecask.com.
BABCOCK VINEYARDS, PINOT NOIR, SANTA BARBARA COUNTY, GRAND CUVEE ESTATE 1998: $50 Rich and concentrated, with sweet and spicy flavors.
BECKMEN VINEYARDS, MARSANNE, SANTA YNEZ VALLEY, PURISIMA MOUNTAIN VINEYARD 1999: $14 Citrus, floral and mineral aromas, with peach and mineral flavors.
BECKMEN VINEYARDS, SYRAH, SANTA BARBARA COUNTY 1997 $22 Spicy, minty aromas; rich, earthy flavors; peppery.
FOLEY ESTATE, CHARDONNAY, BARREL SELECT, SANTA BARBARA COUNTY 1998: $35 Citrus and oak aromas, balanced in the mouth.
FOXEN VINEYARD, PINOT NOIR, SANTA MARIA VALLEY, BIEN NACIDO VINEYARD 1998: $30 Pure ripe cherry aromas, deep fruit flavors, persistent finish.
RICHARD LONGARIA WINES, CHARDONNAY, SANTA YNEZ VALLEY, CLOS PEPE VINEYARD 1998: $28 Powerful citrus and fig aromas, with grapefruit and honey flavors.
ANDREW MURRAY VINEYARDS, SYRAH, SANTA BARBARA COUNTY, LES COTEAUX 1998: $22 Layers of flavor, culminating in chocolate, licorice and cinnamon.
ANDREW MURRAY VINEYARDS, SYRAH, SANTA BARBARA COUNTY, ROASTED SLOPE VINEYARD 1998: $27 Smooth, deep and delicious, with a floral bounce from viognier.
FESS PARKER, MELANGE DU RHONE, SANTA BARBARA COUNTY 1998 $18 Luscious blend of white Rhone grapes with fruit flavors.
QUPE, CHARDONNAY, SANTA BARBARA COUNTY, BIEN NACIDO VINEYARD 1998: $18 Enticing fruity nose, melon and citrus flavors with layers of honey.
WHITCRAFT WINERY, CHARDONNAY, SANTA MARIA VALLEY, BIEN NACIDO VINEYARD 1998: $24 Tangy and zesty, with lemon and mineral flavors, minimal oak.
WHITCRAFT WINERY, PINOT NOIR, SANTA MARIA VALLEY, BIEN NACIDO VINEYARD, Q BLOCK 1998 $45 Rich, ripe and intense, with full-bore berry and spice flavors.
The prices are the suggested retail prices of the wineries.
TASTINGS Correction: May 6, 2000, Saturday A chart on Wednesday with an article about Santa Barbara County wines misspelled the name of a winery. It is Richard Longoria Wines, not Longaria.
